Key Match Events: West Indies cruised to an eight-wicket victory over an experimental England side in Antigua on October 31, 2024.
England named four ODI debutants for the first of three matches against the West Indies.
England's rookie line-up laboured to a disappointing 209 all out from their innings.
Evin Lewis scored a big-hitting 94 to lead West Indies to victory.
Gudakesh Motie was the star of the home bowling attack, registering figures of 4-41.
The hosts' target was revised to 157 from 35 overs due to rain, which they achieved with nine overs to spare.
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Liam Livingstone emphasized the need to get into the rhythms of 50-over cricket and for someone in the top six to get a big score.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies skipper Shai Hope praised Evin Lewis, stating, 'He's hungry. I'm glad with the scores he's getting now.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was rain-affected, leading to a revised target via the Duckworth–Lewis–Stern (DLS) method.
